backend/main.mo: Motoko actor that stores and exposes the latest ESP32 sensor reading (voltage, current, energy, footsteps, battery, USB status) via submitReading, getLatestReading, and getBatteryStatus query/update calls.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping three dashboard features (no-device status, removal of mock data, placeholder states for all panels) to their implementing files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON dictionary of short descriptions for every frontend source file, summarizing each component's purpose and its no-data placeholder behavior.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base stylesheet defining OKLCH CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens (background, foreground, card, chart, sidebar, etc.).
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point that sets the page title to the IoT dashboard name and mounts the React app via the root div and main.tsx module script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that simply renders the DashboardLayout as the sole page of the single-page application.
Energy analysis card that displays an 'AWAITING HARDWARE' muted state when no reading exists and shows voltage/current/footstep metrics with a derived HIGH/NORMAL/LOW output status when real ESP32 data is available.
Sensor analytics card that renders a WifiOff placeholder when no data exists and displays four progress-bar metric rows (voltage, current, energy, footsteps) normalized to percentages when hardware data is present.
frontend/src/components/BatteryLevelPane: Battery level card that shows a 'No Device Connected' WifiOff placeholder when no data exists and renders a percentage readout, fill bar, and segmented indicator with color-coded glow when real battery data is available.
Renders the top header bar for the dashboard with a banner image, scanline overlay, app title, and status badges indicating system online and AI active states.
Defines the overall page layout, composing all dashboard panels (sensor cards, hexagon tiles, battery, USB, AI decision, energy flow, analytics) within a header and footer.
frontend/src/components/EnergyFlowDiagra: Renders an SVG-based energy flow diagram with animated directional arrows between footstep, generator, battery, and device nodes, with active edges determined by the latest voltage reading.
frontend/src/components/HexagonTilePanel: Displays two animated hexagonal tile SVGs representing physical footstep energy tiles, showing step counts and active/idle status based on the latest sensor reading.
Shows a card grid of live sensor values (footsteps, voltage, current, energy) from the latest ESP32 reading, with a disconnected state when no data is available.
frontend/src/components/SensorReadingCar: Displays a four-column card grid of ESP32 live sensor readings (voltage, current, energy, footsteps) with neon accent styling and a no-device-connected fallback state.
frontend/src/components/SimulationContro: Renders a status bar card showing the ESP32 sensor connection state (syncing, data received, or no device connected) with a color-coded indicator dot.
frontend/src/components/USBOutputStatusP: React component that displays USB output charging status (CHARGING/IDLE/NO DEVICE) using battery data from the useBatteryStatus hook, with neon-styled color indicators and a placeholder state when no hardware is connected.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries whenever the actor instance changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider and useInternetIdentity hook for managing DFINITY Internet Identity authentication, exposing login/logout functions and status flags via React context.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching the latest sensor reading (useLatestReading), submitting a new reading (useSubmitReading), and deriving battery/USB status (useBatteryStatus) from the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet importing Orbitron, Share Tech Mono, and Inter fonts, defining CSS custom properties for a dark neon theme, and adding utility classes for glow effects, animations, and scanline overlays.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider wrappers around the root App component.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the theme with neon color tokens (amber, green, cyan, red), Orbitron/Share Tech Mono font families, glow box-shadow utilities, and custom keyframe animations.
project_state.json: Project state metadata tracking the Campus Energy Tile Dashboard's current version, existing features, and a pending action request to replace fake demo data with a 'No Device Connected' placeholder until real ESP32 hardware is connected.
